title: Monthly Budget Calculator
subtitle: Adjust your spending to maximize ETF investments

import.title: Import Revolut Account Statement
import.upload: Upload your Revolut account statement CSV file

presets.title: Quick Presets
presets.description: Click a preset to quickly adjust your expense categories

welcome.title: Welcome to Budget Calculator!
welcome.subtitle: Your personal finance companion
welcome.feature1Desc: Upload your Revolut CSV to automatically categorize expenses
welcome.feature2Desc: Visualize spending across essential and discretionary categories
welcome.feature3Desc: Calculate ideal investment splits and project 10-year growth
welcome.navigateHint: Swipe or use arrow keys to navigate
welcome.step1Content: Plan your monthly budget and discover how much you can afford to invest. Track expenses, set goals, and maximize your savings.
welcome.step2Content: Import your Revolut bank statement for automatic expense categorization, or manually enter your income and expenses using our intuitive calculator.
welcome.step3Content: See exactly how much you can afford to invest each month. Visualize your progress and adjust your spending to maximize ETF investments.

categorization.title: Categorize Transactions
categorization.description: Select a category for each merchant. This will help improve future categorization.

categoryNotes.rent: Fixed monthly housing cost • Most important expense to budget for
categoryNotes.groceries: 256 shopping trips • €12.84 avg per trip • ~5x/week at Lidl, Konzum, Kaufland
categoryNotes.utilities: 48 utility payments • KEKS Pay, telecom (A1, Telemach), CloudFlare hosting
categoryNotes.transport: 214 rides total (196 Bolt, 18 Uber) • €7.38 avg ride • ~17x/month (~1 ride every 2 days)
categoryNotes.health: 40 visits • dm drogerie, pharmacies, dental • €26.43 avg • ~3x/month
categoryNotes.food-delivery: 51 orders over 12 months • €17.55 avg per order • ~4x/month (every 7-8 days)
categoryNotes.fast-food: 34 visits to McDonald's, KFC, Domino's • €10.79 avg • ~3x/month
categoryNotes.subscriptions: 64 recurring charges • YouTube Premium, Cursor, Netflix, CloudFlare, Disney+
categoryNotes.shopping: 20 online orders • €103.55 avg • ~2x/month • Biggest splurge: €533 on Amazon
categoryNotes.gaming: 24 game purchases on Steam • €45.36 avg • ~2x/month • Epic splurge: €569 in one go!
categoryNotes.entertainment: 44 entertainment expenses • €8.34 avg • ~3-4x/month (cinema, events, travel, dining out)

tips.transport: Consider a public transport pass at €50/month to save €{{savings}}!
tips.food-delivery: ~{{orders}} orders/month • Cooking at home could save €{{savings}}/month
tips.fast-food: Consider meal prepping to reduce fast food visits
tips.subscriptions: Review your subscriptions monthly • Cancel unused services to save
tips.shopping: High spending detected • Try a monthly budget of €{{budget}} (10% of income)
tips.gaming: Wait for Steam sales • Game Pass offers 100+ games for €10-15/month
tips.groceries: Groceries are {{percent}}% of income • Try to keep under €{{recommended}} (15%)
tips.rent: Rent is {{percent}}% of income • Aim for max 30% (€{{recommended}})
tips.entertainment: Look for free events and activities to reduce costs

generic.rent: Fixed monthly housing cost • Typically 15-30% of income
generic.groceries: Weekly shopping for essentials • Plan meals to reduce waste
generic.utilities: Electricity, water, internet, phone, and other services
generic.transport: Public transport, ride-sharing, or fuel costs • Consider monthly passes
generic.health: Pharmacy, dental care, gym, and personal care items
generic.food-delivery: Delivery apps like Wolt, Glovo • Cooking at home saves money
generic.fast-food: Quick meals and takeaway • Consider meal prepping
generic.subscriptions: Streaming services, apps, software • Review regularly for unused subs
generic.shopping: Online and retail purchases • Set a monthly limit to avoid impulse buys
generic.gaming: Game purchases and in-game content • Wait for sales to save
generic.books: Books, audiobooks, courses • Libraries and sales offer savings
generic.entertainment: Cinema, events, dining out, travel • Budget for experiences
generic.cash: ATM withdrawals and transfers • Track cash spending carefully
generic.default: Adjust based on your spending habits

critical.title: Critical:
critical.message: You're spending more than you earn! Reduce expenses immediately.

lowSavings.title: Low Savings Rate:
lowSavings.message: Try to save at least 15% of your income. Consider reviewing discretionary expenses.

excellent.title: Excellent!
excellent.message: You're saving over 30% - great job! This puts you on track for financial independence.

good.title: Good!
good.message: You're on track with a healthy savings rate. Keep it up!

emergency.title: Emergency Fund:
emergency.recommended: Build up to €{{amount}} (3 months expenses) before aggressive investing. Current buffer: €{{current}}
emergency.ideal: Good start! Consider building to €{{amount}} (6 months) for better security.
